2: SIÞEN þe sege and þe assaut watz sesed at Troye,
3: Þe borȝ brittened and brent to brondeȝ and askez,
4: Þe tulk þat þe trammes of tresoun þer wroȝt
5: Watz tried for his tricherie, þe trewest on erþe:
6: Hit watz Ennias þe athel, and his highe kynde,
7: Þat siþen depreced prouinces, and patrounes bicome
8: Welneȝe of al þe wele in þe west iles.
9: Fro riche Romulus to Rome ricchis hym swyþe,
10: With gret bobbaunce þat burȝe he biges vpon fyrst,
11: And neuenes hit his aune nome, as hit now hat;
12: Tirius to Tuskan and teldes bigynnes,
13: Langaberde in Lumbardie lyftes vp homes,
14: And fer ouer þe French flod Felix Brutus
15: On mony bonkkes ful brode Bretayn he settez
17: Where werre and wrake and wonder
19: And oft boþe blysse and blunder
21: Ande quen þis Bretayn watz bigged bi þis burn rych,
22: Bolde bredden þerinne, baret þat lofden,
23: In mony turned tyme tene þat wroȝten.
24: Mo ferlyes on þis folde han fallen here oft
25: Þen in any oþer þat I wot, syn þat ilk tyme.
26: Bot of alle þat here bult, of Bretaygne kynges,
27: Ay watz Arthur þe hendest, as I haf herde telle.
28: Forþi an aunter in erde I attle to schawe,
29: Þat a selly in siȝt summe men hit holden,
30: And an outtrage awenture of Arthurez wonderez.
31: If ȝe wyl lysten þis laye bot on littel quile,
32: I schal telle hit as-tit, as I in toun herde,
34: As hit is stad and stoken
37: In londe so hatz ben longe.
38: Þis kyng lay at Camylot vpon Krystmasse
39: With mony luflych lorde, ledez of þe best,
40: Rekenly of þe Rounde Table alle þo rich breþer,
41: With rych reuel oryȝt and rechles merþes.
42: Þer tournayed tulkes by tymez ful mony,
43: Justed ful jolilé þise gentyle kniȝtes,
44: Syþen kayred to þe court caroles to make.
45: For þer þe fest watz ilyche ful fiften dayes,
46: With alle þe mete and þe mirþe þat men couþe avyse;
47: Such glaum ande gle glorious to here,
48: Dere dyn vpon day, daunsyng on nyȝtes,
49: Al watz hap vpon heȝe in hallez and chambrez
50: With lordez and ladies, as leuest him þoȝt.
51: With all þe wele of þe worlde þay woned þer samen,
52: Þe most kyd knyȝtez vnder Krystes seluen,
53: And þe louelokkest ladies þat euer lif haden,
54: And he þe comlokest kyng þat þe court haldes;
55: For al watz þis fayre folk in her first age,
59: Hit were now gret nye to neuen
60: So hardy a here on hille.
61: Wyle Nw Ȝer watz so ȝep þat hit watz nwe cummen,
62: Þat day doubble on þe dece watz þe douth serued.
63: Fro þe kyng watz cummen with knyȝtes into þe halle,
64: Þe chauntré of þe chapel cheued to an ende,
65: Loude crye watz þer kest of clerkez and oþer,
66: Nowel nayted onewe, neuened ful ofte;
67: And syþen riche forth runnen to reche hondeselle,
68: Ȝeȝed ȝeres-ȝiftes on hiȝ, ȝelde hem bi hond,
70: Ladies laȝed ful loude, þoȝ þay lost haden,
71: And he þat wan watz not wrothe, þat may ȝe wel trawe.
72: Alle þis mirþe þay maden to þe mete tyme;
73: When þay had waschen worþyly þay wenten to sete,
74: Þe best burne ay abof, as hit best semed,
75: Whene Guenore, ful gay, grayþed in þe myddes,
76: Dressed on þe dere des, dubbed al aboute,
77: Smal sendal bisides, a selure hir ouer
78: Of tryed tolouse, and tars tapites innoghe,
79: Þat were enbrawded and beten wyth þe best gemmes
80: Þat myȝt be preued of prys wyth penyes to bye,
84: A semloker þat euer he syȝe
86: Bot Arthure wolde not ete til al were serued,
87: He watz so joly of his joyfnes, and sumquat childgered:
88: His lif liked hym lyȝt, he louied þe lasse
89: Auþer to longe lye or to longe sitte,
90: So bisied him his ȝonge blod and his brayn wylde.
91: And also an oþer maner meued him eke
92: Þat he þurȝ nobelay had nomen, he wolde neuer ete
93: Vpon such a dere day er hym deuised were
94: Of sum auenturus þyng an vncouþe tale,
95: Of sum mayn meruayle, þat he myȝt trawe,
96: Of alderes, of armes, of oþer auenturus,
97: Oþer sum segg hym bisoȝt of sum siker knyȝt
98: To joyne wyth hym in iustyng, in jopardé to lay,
99: Lede, lif for lyf, leue vchon oþer,
100: As fortune wolde fulsun hom, þe fayrer to haue.
101: Þis watz þe kynges countenaunce where he in court were,
102: At vch farand fest among his fre meny
106: Ful ȝep in þat Nw Ȝere
108: Thus þer stondes in stale þe stif kyng hisseluen,
109: Talkkande bifore þe hyȝe table of trifles ful hende.
110: There gode Gawan watz grayþed Gwenore bisyde,
111: And Agrauayn a la dure mayn on þat oþer syde sittes,
112: Boþe þe kynges sistersunes and ful siker kniȝtes;
113: Bischop Bawdewyn abof biginez þe table,
114: And Ywan, Vryn son, ette with hymseluen.
115: Þise were diȝt on þe des and derworþly serued,
116: And siþen mony siker segge at þe sidbordez.
117: Þen þe first cors come with crakkyng of trumpes,
118: Wyth mony baner ful bryȝt þat þerbi henged;
119: Nwe nakryn noyse with þe noble pipes,
120: Wylde werbles and wyȝt wakned lote,
121: Þat mony hert ful hiȝe hef at her towches.
122: Dayntés dryuen þerwyth of ful dere metes,
123: Foysoun of þe fresche, and on so fele disches
124: Þat pine to fynde þe place þe peple biforne
125: For to sette þe sylueren þat sere sewes halden
127: Iche lede as he loued hymselue
130: Good ber and bryȝt wyn boþe.
131: Now wyl I of hor seruise say yow no more,
132: For vch wyȝe may wel wit no wont þat þer were.
133: An oþer noyse ful newe neȝed biliue,
134: Þat þe lude myȝt haf leue liflode to cach;
135: For vneþe watz þe noyce not a whyle sesed,
136: And þe fyrst cource in þe court kyndely serued,
137: Þer hales in at þe halle dor an aghlich mayster,
138: On þe most on þe molde on mesure hyghe;
139: Fro þe swyre to þe swange so sware and so þik,
140: And his lyndes and his lymes so longe and so grete,
141: Half etayn in erde I hope þat he were,
142: Bot mon most I algate mynn hym to bene,
143: And þat þe myriest in his muckel þat myȝt ride;
144: For of bak and of brest al were his bodi sturne,
145: Both his wombe and his wast were worthily smale,
146: And alle his fetures folȝande, in forme þat he hade,
148: For wonder of his hwe men hade,
150: He ferde as freke were fade,
152: Ande al grayþed in grene þis gome and his wedes:
153: A strayte cote ful streȝt, þat stek on his sides,
154: A meré mantile abof, mensked withinne
155: With pelure pured apert, þe pane ful clene
156: With blyþe blaunner ful bryȝt, and his hod boþe,
157: Þat watz laȝt fro his lokkez and layde on his schulderes;
158: Heme wel-haled hose of þat same,
159: Þat spenet on his sparlyr, and clene spures vnder
160: Of bryȝt golde, vpon silk bordes barred ful ryche,
161: And scholes vnder schankes þere þe schalk rides;
162: And alle his vesture uerayly watz clene verdure,
163: Boþe þe barres of his belt and oþer blyþe stones,
164: Þat were richely rayled in his aray clene
165: Aboutte hymself and his sadel, vpon silk werkez.
166: Þat were to tor for to telle of tryfles þe halue
167: Þat were enbrauded abof, wyth bryddes and flyȝes,
168: With gay gaudi of grene, þe golde ay inmyddes.
169: Þe pendauntes of his payttrure, þe proude cropure,
170: His molaynes, and alle þe metail anamayld was þenne,
171: Þe steropes þat he stod on stayned of þe same,
172: And his arsounz al after and his aþel skyrtes,
173: Þat euer glemered and glent al of grene stones;
174: Þe fole þat he ferkkes on fyn of þat ilke,
176: A grene hors gret and þikke,
177: A stede ful stif to strayne,
179: To þe gome he watz ful gayn.
180: Wel gay watz þis gome gered in grene,
181: And þe here of his hed of his hors swete.
182: Fayre fannand fax vmbefoldes his schulderes;
183: A much berd as a busk ouer his brest henges,
184: Þat wyth his hiȝlich here þat of his hed reches
185: Watz euesed al vmbetorne abof his elbowes,
186: Þat half his armes þer-vnder were halched in þe wyse
187: Of a kyngez capados þat closes his swyre;
188: Þe mane of þat mayn hors much to hit lyke,
189: Wel cresped and cemmed, wyth knottes ful mony
190: Folden in wyth fildore aboute þe fayre grene,
191: Ay a herle of þe here, an oþer of golde;
192: Þe tayl and his toppyng twynnen of a sute,
193: And bounden boþe wyth a bande of a bryȝt grene,
194: Dubbed wyth ful dere stonez, as þe dok lasted,
195: Syþen þrawen wyth a þwong a þwarle knot alofte,
196: Þer mony bellez ful bryȝt of brende golde rungen.
197: Such a fole vpon folde, ne freke þat hym rydes,
198: Watz neuer sene in þat sale wyth syȝt er þat tyme,
200: He loked as layt so lyȝt,
201: So sayd al þat hym syȝe;
202: Hit semed as no mon myȝt
204: Wheþer hade he no helme ne hawbergh nauþer,
205: Ne no pysan ne no plate þat pented to armes,
206: Ne no schafte ne no schelde to schwue ne to smyte,
207: Bot in his on honde he hade a holyn bobbe,
208: Þat is grattest in grene when greuez ar bare,
209: And an ax in his oþer, a hoge and vnmete,
210: A spetos sparþe to expoun in spelle, quoso myȝt.
211: Þe lenkþe of an elnȝerde þe large hede hade,
212: Þe grayn al of grene stele and of golde hewen,
213: Þe bit burnyst bryȝt, with a brod egge
214: As wel schapen to schere as scharp rasores,
215: Þe stele of a stif staf þe sturne hit bi grypte,
216: Þat watz wounden wyth yrn to þe wandez ende,
217: And al bigrauen with grene in gracios werkes;
218: A lace lapped aboute, þat louked at þe hede,
219: And so after þe halme halched ful ofte,
220: Wyth tryed tasselez þerto tacched innoghe
221: On botounz of þe bryȝt grene brayden ful ryche.
222: Þis haþel heldez hym in and þe halle entres,
223: Driuande to þe heȝe dece, dut he no woþe,
224: Haylsed he neuer one, bot heȝe he ouer loked.
225: Þe fyrst word þat he warp, 'Wher is', he sayd,
226: 'Þe gouernour of þis gyng? Gladly I wolde
227: Se þat segg in syȝt, and with hymself speke
229: To knyȝtez he kest his yȝe,
230: And reled hym vp and doun;
233: Ther watz lokyng on lenþe þe lude to beholde,
234: For vch mon had meruayle quat hit mene myȝt
235: Þat a haþel and a horse myȝt such a hwe lach,
236: As growe grene as þe gres and grener hit semed,
237: Þen grene aumayl on golde glowande bryȝter.
238: Al studied þat þer stod, and stalked hym nerre
239: Wyth al þe wonder of þe worlde what he worch schulde.
240: For fele sellyez had þay sen, bot such neuer are;
241: Forþi for fantoum and fayryȝe þe folk þere hit demed.
242: Þerfore to answare watz arȝe mony aþel freke,
243: And al stouned at his steuen and stonstil seten
244: In a swoghe sylence þurȝ þe sale riche;
245: As al were slypped vpon slepe so slaked hor lotez
247: I deme hit not al for doute,
249: Bot let hym þat al schulde loute
251: Þenn Arþour bifore þe hiȝ dece þat auenture byholdez,
252: And rekenly hym reuerenced, for rad was he neuer,
253: And sayde, 'Wyȝe, welcum iwys to þis place,
254: Þe hede of þis ostel Arthour I hat;
255: Liȝt luflych adoun and lenge, I þe praye,
256: And quat-so þy wylle is we schal wyt after.'
257: 'Nay, as help me,' quoþ þe haþel, 'he þat on hyȝe syttes,
258: To wone any quyle in þis won, hit watz not myn ernde;
259: Bot for þe los of þe, lede, is lyft vp so hyȝe,
260: And þy burȝ and þy burnes best ar holden,
261: Stifest vnder stel-gere on stedes to ryde,
262: Þe wyȝtest and þe worþyest of þe worldes kynde,
263: Preue for to play wyth in oþer pure laykez,
264: And here is kydde cortaysye, as I haf herd carp,
265: And þat hatz wayned me hider, iwyis, at þis tyme.
266: Ȝe may be seker bi þis braunch þat I bere here
267: Þat I passe as in pes, and no plyȝt seche;
268: For had I founded in fere in feȝtyng wyse,
269: I haue a hauberghe at home and a helme boþe,
270: A schelde and a scharp spere, schinande bryȝt,
271: Ande oþer weppenes to welde, I wene wel, als;
272: Bot for I wolde no were, my wedez ar softer.
273: Bot if þou be so bold as alle burnez tellen,
274: Þou wyl grant me godly þe gomen þat I ask
279: Here faylez þou not to fyȝt.'
280: 'Nay, frayst I no fyȝt, in fayth I þe telle,
281: Hit arn aboute on þis bench bot berdlez chylder.
282: If I were hasped in armes on a heȝe stede,
283: Here is no mon me to mach, for myȝtez so wayke.
284: Forþy I craue in þis court a Crystemas gomen,
285: For hit is Ȝol and Nwe Ȝer, and here ar ȝep mony:
286: If any so hardy in þis hous holdez hymseluen,
287: Be so bolde in his blod, brayn in hys hede,
288: Þat dar stifly strike a strok for an oþer,
289: I schal gif hym of my gyft þys giserne ryche,
290: Þis ax, þat is heué innogh, to hondele as hym lykes,
291: And I schal bide þe fyrst bur as bare as I sitte.
292: If any freke be so felle to fonde þat I telle,
293: Lepe lyȝtly me to, and lach þis weppen,
294: I quit-clayme hit for euer, kepe hit as his auen,
295: And I schal stonde hym a strok, stif on þis flet,
296: Ellez þou wyl diȝt me þe dom to dele hym an oþer
300: Now hyȝe, and let se tite
302: If he hem stowned vpon fyrst, stiller were þanne
303: Alle þe heredmen in halle, þe hyȝ and þe loȝe.
304: Þe renk on his rouncé hym ruched in his sadel,
305: And runischly his rede yȝen he reled aboute,
306: Bende his bresed broȝez, blycande grene,
307: Wayued his berde for to wayte quo-so wolde ryse.
308: When non wolde kepe hym with carp he coȝed ful hyȝe,
309: Ande rimed hym ful richly, and ryȝt hym to speke:
310: 'What, is þis Arthures hous,' quoþ þe haþel þenne,
311: 'Þat al þe rous rennes of þurȝ ryalmes so mony?
312: Where is now your sourquydrye and your conquestes,
313: Your gryndellayk and your greme, and your grete wordes?
314: Now is þe reuel and þe renoun of þe Rounde Table
315: Ouerwalt wyth a worde of on wyȝes speche,
316: For al dares for drede withoute dynt schewed!'
317: Wyth þis he laȝes so loude þat þe lorde greued;
318: Þe blod schot for scham into his schyre face
320: He wex as wroth as wynde,
321: So did alle þat þer were.
322: Þe kyng as kene bi kynde
323: Þen stod þat stif mon nere,
324: Ande sayde, 'Haþel, by heuen, þyn askyng is nys,
325: And as þou foly hatz frayst, fynde þe behoues.
326: I know no gome þat is gast of þy grete wordes;
327: Gif me now þy geserne, vpon Godez halue,
328: And I schal bayþen þy bone þat þou boden habbes.'
329: Lyȝtly lepez he hym to, and laȝt at his honde.
330: Þen feersly þat oþer freke vpon fote lyȝtis.
331: Now hatz Arthure his axe, and þe halme grypez,
332: And sturnely sturez hit aboute, þat stryke wyth hit þoȝt.
333: Þe stif mon hym bifore stod vpon hyȝt,
334: Herre þen ani in þe hous by þe hede and more.
335: Wyth sturne schere þer he stod he stroked his berde,
336: And wyth a countenaunce dryȝe he droȝ doun his cote,
337: No more mate ne dismayd for hys mayn dintez
338: Þen any burne vpon bench hade broȝt hym to drynk
340: Gawan, þat sate bi þe quene,
341: To þe kyng he can enclyne:
344: 'Wolde ȝe, worþilych lorde,' quoþ Wawan to þe kyng,
345: 'Bid me boȝe fro þis benche, and stonde by yow þere,
346: Þat I wythoute vylanye myȝt voyde þis table,
347: And þat my legge lady lyked not ille,
348: I wolde com to your counseyl bifore your cort ryche.
349: For me þink hit not semly, as hit is soþ knawen,
350: Þer such an askyng is heuened so hyȝe in your sale,
351: Þaȝ ȝe ȝourself be talenttyf, to take hit to yourseluen,
352: Whil mony so bolde yow aboute vpon bench sytten,
353: Þat vnder heuen I hope non haȝerer of wylle,
354: Ne better bodyes on bent þer baret is rered.
355: I am þe wakkest, I wot, and of wyt feblest,
356: And lest lur of my lyf, quo laytes þe soþe--
357: Bot for as much as ȝe ar myn em I am only to prayse,
358: No bounté bot your blod I in my bodé knowe;
359: And syþen þis note is so nys þat noȝt hit yow falles,
360: And I haue frayned hit at yow fyrst, foldez hit to me;
361: And if I carp not comlyly, let alle þis cort rych
364: And syþen þay redden alle same
365: To ryd þe kyng wyth croun,
367: Þen comaunded þe kyng þe knyȝt for to ryse;
368: And he ful radly vpros, and ruchched hym fayre,
369: Kneled doun bifore þe kyng, and cachez þat weppen;
370: And he luflyly hit hym laft, and lyfte vp his honde,
371: And gef hym Goddez blessyng, and gladly hym biddes
372: Þat his hert and his honde schulde hardi be boþe.
373: 'Kepe þe cosyn,' quoþ þe kyng, 'þat þou on kyrf sette,
374: And if þou redeȝ hym ryȝt, redly I trowe
375: Þat þou schal byden þe bur þat he schal bede after.'
376: Gawan gotz to þe gome with giserne in honde,
377: And he baldly hym bydez, he bayst neuer þe helder.
378: Þen carppez to Sir Gawan þe knyȝt in þe grene,
379: 'Refourme we oure forwardes, er we fyrre passe.
380: Fyrst I eþe þe, haþel, how þat þou hattes
381: Þat þou me telle truly, as I tryst may.'
382: 'In god fayth,' quoþ þe goode knyȝt, 'Gawan I hatte,
383: Þat bede þe þis buffet, quat-so bifallez after,
384: And at þis tyme twelmonyth take at þe an oþer
385: Wyth what weppen so þou wylt, and wyth no wyȝ ellez
390: Þis dint þat þou schal dryue.
391: 'Bigog,' quoþ þe grene knyȝt, 'Sir Gawan, me lykes
392: Þat I schal fange at þy fust þat I haf frayst here.
393: And þou hatz redily rehersed, bi resoun ful trwe,
394: Clanly al þe couenaunt þat I þe kynge asked,
395: Saf þat þou schal siker me, segge, bi þi trawþe,
396: Þat þou schal seche me þiself, where-so þou hopes
397: I may be funde vpon folde, and foch þe such wages
398: As þou deles me to-day bifore þis douþe ryche.'
399: 'Where schulde I wale þe,' quoþ Gauan, 'where is þy place?
400: I wot neuer where þou wonyes, bi hym þat me wroȝt,
401: Ne I know not þe, knyȝt, by cort ne þi name.
402: Bot teche me truly þerto, and telle me how þou hattes,
403: And I schal ware alle my wyt to wynne me þeder,
404: And þat I swere þe for soþe, and by my seker traweþ.'
405: 'Þat is innogh in Nwe Ȝer, hit nedes no more',
406: Quoþ þe gome in þe grene to Gawan þe hende;
407: 'Ȝif I þe telle trwly, quen I þe tape haue
408: And þou me smoþely hatz smyten, smartly I þe teche
409: Of my hous and my home and myn owen nome,
410: Þen may þou frayst my fare and forwardez holde;
411: And if I spende no speche, þenne spedez þou þe better,
412: For þou may leng in þy londe and layt no fyrre--
414: Ta now þy grymme tole to þe,
415: And let se how þou cnokez.'
417: Quoþ Gawan; his ax he strokes.
418: Þe grene knyȝt vpon grounde grayþely hym dresses,
419: A littel lut with þe hede, þe lere he discouerez,
420: His longe louelych lokkez he layd ouer his croun,
421: Let þe naked nec to þe note schewe.
422: Gauan gripped to his ax, and gederes hit on hyȝt,
423: Þe kay fot on þe folde he before sette,
424: Let him doun lyȝtly lyȝt on þe naked,
425: Þat þe scharp of þe schalk schyndered þe bones,
426: And schrank þurȝ þe schyire grece, and schade hit in twynne,
427: Þat þe bit of þe broun stel bot on þe grounde.
428: Þe fayre hede fro þe halce hit to þe erþe,
429: Þat fele hit foyned wyth her fete, þere hit forth roled;
430: Þe blod brayd fro þe body, þat blykked on þe grene;
431: And nawþer faltered ne fel þe freke neuer þe helder,
432: Bot styþly he start forth vpon styf schonkes,
433: And runyschly he raȝt out, þere as renkkez stoden,
434: Laȝt to his lufly hed, and lyft hit vp sone;
435: And syþen boȝez to his blonk, þe brydel he cachchez,
436: Steppez into stelbawe and strydez alofte,
437: And his hede by þe here in his honde haldez;
438: And as sadly þe segge hym in his sadel sette
439: As non vnhap had hym ayled, þaȝ hedlez he were
443: Moni on of hym had doute,
444: Bi þat his resounz were redde.
445: For þe hede in his honde he haldez vp euen,
446: Toward þe derrest on þe dece he dressez þe face,
447: And hit lyfte vp þe yȝe-lyddez and loked ful brode,
448: And meled þus much with his muthe, as ȝe may now here:
449: 'Loke, Gawan, þou be grayþe to go as þou hettez,
450: And layte as lelly til þou me, lude, fynde,
451: As þou hatz hette in þis halle, herande þise knyȝtes;
452: To þe grene chapel þou chose, I charge þe, to fotte
453: Such a dunt as þou hatz dalt--disserued þou habbez
454: To be ȝederly ȝolden on Nw Ȝeres morn.
455: Þe knyȝt of þe grene chapel men knowen me mony;
456: Forþi me for to fynde if þou fraystez, faylez þou neuer.
457: Þerfore com, oþer recreaunt be calde þe behoues.'
458: With a runisch rout þe raynez he tornez,
459: Halled out at þe hal dor, his hed in his hande,
460: Þat þe fyr of þe flynt flaȝe fro fole houes.
461: To quat kyth he becom knwe non þere,
462: Neuer more þen þay wyste from queþen he watz wonnen.
465: At þat grene þay laȝe and grenne,
466: Ȝet breued watz hit ful bare
468: Þaȝ Arþer þe hende kyng at hert hade wonder,
469: He let no semblaunt be sene, bot sayde ful hyȝe
470: To þe comlych quene wyth cortays speche,
472: Wel bycommes such craft vpon Cristmasse,
473: Laykyng of enterludez, to laȝe and to syng,
474: Among þise kynde caroles of knyȝtez and ladyez.
475: Neuer þe lece to my mete I may me wel dres,
476: For I haf sen a selly, I may not forsake.'
477: He glent vpon Sir Gawen, and gaynly he sayde,
478: 'Now, sir, heng vp þyn ax, þat hatz innogh hewen';
479: And hit watz don abof þe dece on doser to henge,
480: Þer alle men for meruayl myȝt on hit loke,
481: And bi trwe tytel þerof to telle þe wonder.
482: Þenne þay boȝed to a borde þise burnes togeder,
483: Þe kyng and þe gode knyȝt, and kene men hem serued
484: Of alle dayntyez double, as derrest myȝt falle;
485: Wyth alle maner of mete and mynstralcie boþe,
486: Wyth wele walt þday, til worþed an ende
489: For woþe þat þou ne wonde
491: Þat þou hatz tan on honde.
493: THIS hanselle hatz Arthur of auenturus on fyrst
494: In ȝonge ȝer, for he ȝerned ȝelpyng to here.
495: Thaȝ hym wordez were wane when þay to sete wenten,
496: Now ar þay stoken of sturne werk, stafful her hond.
497: Gawan watz glad to begynne þose gomnez in halle,
498: Bot þaȝ þe ende be heuy haf ȝe no wonder;
499: For þaȝ men ben mery in mynde quen þay han mayn drynk,
500: A ȝere ȝernes ful ȝerne, and ȝeldez neuer lyke,
501: Þe forme to þe fynisment foldez ful selden.
502: Forþi þis Ȝol ouerȝede, and þe ȝere after,
503: And vche sesoun serlepes sued after oþer:
504: After Crystenmasse com þe crabbed lentoun,
505: Þat fraystez flesch wyth þe fysche and fode more symple;
506: Bot þenne þe weder of þe worlde wyth wynter hit þrepez,
508: Schyre schedez þe rayn in schowrez ful warme,
509: Fallez vpon fayre flat, flowrez þere schewen,
510: Boþe groundez and þe greuez grene ar her wedez,
511: Bryddez busken to bylde, and bremlych syngen
512: For solace of þe softe somer þat sues þerafter
517: Ar herde in wod so wlonk.
518: After þe sesoun of somer wyth þe soft wyndez
519: Quen Zeferus syflez hymself on sedez and erbez,
520: Wela wynne is þe wort þat waxes þeroute,
521: When þe donkande dewe dropez of þe leuez,
522: To bide a blysful blusch of þe bryȝt sunne.
523: Bot þen hyȝes heruest, and hardenes hym sone,
524: Warnez hym for þe wynter to wax ful rype;
525: He dryues wyth droȝt þe dust for to ryse,
526: Fro þe face of þe folde to flyȝe ful hyȝe;
527: Wroþe wynde of þe welkyn wrastelez with þe sunne,
528: Þe leuez lancen fro þe lynde and lyȝten on þe grounde,
529: And al grayes þe gres þat grene watz ere;
530: Þenne al rypez and rotez þat ros vpon fyrst,
531: And þus ȝirnez þe ȝere in ȝisterdayez mony,
532: And wynter wyndez aȝayn, as þe worlde askez,
538: Ȝet quyl Al-hal-day with Arþer he lenges;
539: And he made a fare on þat fest for þe frekez sake,
540: With much reuel and ryche of þe Rounde Table.
541: Knyȝtez ful cortays and comlych ladies
542: Al for luf of þat lede in longynge þay were,
543: Bot neuer þe lece ne þe later þay neuened bot merþe:
544: Mony ioylez for þat ientyle iapez þer maden.
545: For aftter mete with mournyng he melez to his eme,
546: And spekez of his passage, and pertly he sayde,
547: 'Now, lege lorde of my lyf, leue I yow ask;
548: Ȝe knowe þe cost of þis cace, kepe I no more
549: To telle yow tenez þerof neuer bot trifel;
550: Bot I am boun to þe bur barely to-morne
551: To sech þe gome of þe grene, as God wyl me wysse.'
552: Þenne þe best of þe burȝ boȝed togeder,
553: Aywan, and Errik, and oþer ful mony,
554: Sir Doddinaual de Sauage, þe duk of Clarence,
555: Launcelot, and Lyonel, and Lucan þe gode,
556: Sir Boos, and Sir Byduer, big men boþe,
557: And mony oþer menskful, with Mador de la Port.
558: Alle þis compayny of court com þe kyng nerre
559: For to counseyl þe knyȝt, with care at her hert.
560: Þere watz much derue doel driuen in þe sale
561: Þat so worþé as Wawan schulde wende on þat ernde,
562: To dryȝe a delful dynt, and dele no more
564: Þe knyȝt mad ay god chere,
567: What may mon do bot fonde?'
568: He dowellez þer al þat day, and dressez on þe morn,
569: Askez erly hys armez, and alle were þay broȝt.
570: Fyrst a tulé tapit tyȝt ouer þe flet,
571: And miche watz þe gyld gere þat glent þeralofte;
572: Þe stif mon steppez þeron, and þe stel hondelez,
573: Dubbed in a dublet of a dere tars,
574: And syþen a crafty capados, closed aloft,
575: Þat wyth a bryȝt blaunner was bounden withinne.
576: Þenne set þay þe sabatounz vpon þe segge fotez,
577: His legez lapped in stel with luflych greuez,
578: With polaynez piched þerto, policed ful clene,
579: Aboute his knez knaged wyth knotez of golde;
580: Queme quyssewes þen, þat coyntlych closed
581: His thik þrawen þyȝez, with þwonges to tachched;
582: And syþen þe brawden bryné of bryȝt stel ryngez
583: Vmbeweued þat wyȝ vpon wlonk stuffe,
584: And wel bornyst brace vpon his boþe armes,
585: With gode cowters and gay, and glouez of plate,
586: And alle þe godlych gere þat hym gayn schulde
589: His gold sporez spend with pryde,
590: Gurde wyth a bront ful sure
591: With silk sayn vmbe his syde.
592: When he watz hasped in armes, his harnays watz ryche:
593: Þe lest lachet ouer loupe lemed of golde.
594: So harnayst as he watz he herknez his masse,
595: Offred and honoured at þe heȝe auter.
596: Syþen he comez to þe kyng and to his cort-ferez,
597: Lachez lufly his leue at lordez and ladyez;
598: And þay hym kyst and conueyed, bikende hym to Kryst.
599: Bi þat watz Gryngolet grayth, and gurde with a sadel
600: Þat glemed ful gayly with mony golde frenges,
601: Ayquere naylet ful nwe, for þat note ryched;
602: Þe brydel barred aboute, with bryȝt golde bounden;
603: Þe apparayl of þe payttrure and of þe proude skyrtez,
604: Þe cropore and þe couertor, acorded wyth þe arsounez;
605: And al watz rayled on red ryche golde naylez,
606: Þat al glytered and glent as glem of þe sunne.
607: Þenne hentes he þe helme, and hastily hit kysses,
608: Þat watz stapled stifly, and stoffed wythinne.
609: Hit watz hyȝe on his hede, hasped bihynde,
610: Wyth a lyȝtly vrysoun ouer þe auentayle,
611: Enbrawden and bounden wyth þe best gemmez
612: On brode sylkyn borde, and bryddez on semez,
614: Tortors and trulofez entayled so þyk
615: As mony burde þeraboute had ben seuen wynter
617: Þe cercle watz more o prys
620: Þat boþe were bryȝt and broun.
621: THEN þay schewed hym þe schelde, þat was of schyr goulez
622: Wyth þe pentangel depaynt of pure golde hwez.
623: He braydez hit by þe bauderyk, aboute þe hals kestes,
624: Þat bisemed þe segge semlyly fayre.
625: And quy þe pentangel apendez to þat prynce noble
626: I am in tent yow to telle, þof tary hyt me schulde:
627: Hit is a syngne þat Salamon set sumquyle
628: In bytoknyng of trawþe, bi tytle þat hit habbez,
629: For hit is a figure þat haldez fyue poyntez,
630: And vche lyne vmbelappez and loukez in oþer,
631: And ayquere hit is endelez; and Englych hit callen
632: Oueral, as I here, þe endeles knot.
633: Forþy hit acordez to þis knyȝt and to his cler armez,
634: For ay faythful in fyue and sere fyue syþez
635: Gawan watz for gode knawen, and as golde pured,
636: Voyded of vche vylany, wyth vertuez ennourned
639: He ber in schelde and cote,
640: As tulk of tale most trwe
642: Fyrst he watz funden fautlez in his fyue wyttez,
643: And efte fayled neuer þe freke in his fyue fyngres,
644: And alle his afyaunce vpon folde watz in þe fyue woundez
645: Þat Cryst kaȝt on þe croys, as þe crede tellez;
646: And quere-so-euer þys mon in melly watz stad,
647: His þro þoȝt watz in þat, þurȝ alle oþer þyngez,
648: Þat alle his forsnes he feng at þe fyue joyez
649: Þat þe hende heuen-quene had of hir chylde;
650: At þis cause þe knyȝt comlyche hade
651: In þe inore half of his schelde hir ymage depaynted,
652: Þat quen he blusched þerto his belde neuer payred.
653: Þe fyft fyue þat I finde þat þe frek vsed
654: Watz fraunchyse and felaȝschyp forbe al þyng,
655: His clannes and his cortaysye croked were neuer,
656: And pité, þat passez alle poyntez, þyse pure fyue
657: Were harder happed on þat haþel þen on any oþer.
658: Now alle þese fyue syþez, for soþe, were fetled on þis knyȝt,
659: And vchone halched in oþer, þat non ende hade,
660: And fyched vpon fyue poyntez, þat fayld neuer,
661: Ne samned neuer in no syde, ne sundred nouþer,
662: Withouten ende at any noke I oquere fynde,
663: Whereeuer þe gomen bygan, or glod to an ende.
664: Þerfore on his schene schelde schapen watz þe knot
665: Ryally wyth red golde vpon rede gowlez,
666: Þat is þe pure pentaungel wyth þe peple called
669: And laȝt his launce ryȝt þore,
670: And gef hem alle goud day,
672: He sperred þe sted with þe spurez and sprong on his way,
673: So stif þat þe ston-fyr stroke out þerafter.
674: Al þat seȝ þat semly syked in hert,
675: And sayde soþly al same segges til oþer,
676: Carande for þat comly: 'Bi Kryst, hit is scaþe
677: Þat þou, leude, schal be lost, þat art of lyf noble!
678: To fynde hys fere vpon folde, in fayth, is not eþe.
679: Warloker to haf wroȝt had more wyt bene,
680: And haf dyȝt ȝonder dere a duk to haue worþed;
681: A lowande leder of ledez in londe hym wel semez,
682: And so had better haf ben þen britned to noȝt,
683: Hadet wyth an aluisch mon, for angardez pryde.
684: Who knew euer any kyng such counsel to take
685: As knyȝtez in cauelaciounz on Crystmasse gomnez!'
686: Wel much watz þe warme water þat waltered of yȝen,
687: When þat semly syre soȝt fro þo wonez
692: Þe bok as I herde say.
693: Now ridez þis renk þurȝ þe ryalme of Logres,
694: Sir Gauan, on Godez halue, þaȝ hym no gomen þoȝt.
695: Oft leudlez alone he lengez on nyȝtez
696: Þer he fonde noȝt hym byfore þe fare þat he lyked.
697: Hade he no fere bot his fole bi frythez and dounez,
698: Ne no gome bot God bi gate wyth to karp,
699: Til þat he neȝed ful neghe into þe Norþe Walez.
700: Alle þe iles of Anglesay on lyft half he haldez,
701: And farez ouer þe fordez by þe forlondez,
702: Ouer at þe Holy Hede, til he hade eft bonk
703: In þe wyldrenesse of Wyrale; wonde þer bot lyte
704: Þat auþer God oþer gome wyth goud hert louied.
705: And ay he frayned, as he ferde, at frekez þat he met,
706: If þay hade herde any karp of a knyȝt grene,
707: In any grounde þeraboute, of þe grene chapel;
708: And al nykked hym wyth nay, þat neuer in her lyue
709: Þay seȝe neuer no segge þat watz of suche hwez
713: His cher ful oft con chaunge
714: Þat chapel er he myȝt sene.
715: Mony klyf he ouerclambe in contrayez straunge,
716: Fer floten fro his frendez fremedly he rydez.
717: At vche warþe oþer water þer þe wyȝe passed
718: He fonde a foo hym byfore, bot ferly hit were,
719: And þat so foule and so felle þat feȝt hym byhode.
720: So mony meruayl bi mount þer þe mon fyndez,
721: Hit were to tore for to telle of þe tenþe dole.
722: Sumwhyle wyth wormez he werrez, and with wolues als,
723: Sumwhyle wyth wodwos, þat woned in þe knarrez,
724: Boþe wyth bullez and berez, and borez oþerquyle,
725: And etaynez, þat hym anelede of þe heȝe felle;
726: Nade he ben duȝty and dryȝe, and Dryȝtyn had serued,
727: Douteles he hade ben ded and dreped ful ofte.
728: For werre wrathed hym not so much þat wynter nas wors,
729: When þe colde cler water fro þe cloudez schadde,
730: And fres er hit falle myȝt to þe fale erþe;
731: Ner slayn wyth þe slete he sleped in his yrnes
732: Mo nyȝtez þen innoghe in naked rokkez,
733: Þer as claterande fro þe crest þe colde borne rennez,
734: And henged heȝe ouer his hede in hard iisse-ikkles.
735: Þus in peryl and payne and plytes ful harde
736: Bi contray cayrez þis knyȝt, tyl Krystmasse euen,
740: Þat ho hym red to ryde
741: And wysse hym to sum wone.
742: Bi a mounte on þe morne meryly he rydes
743: Into a forest ful dep, þat ferly watz wylde,
744: Hiȝe hillez on vche a halue, and holtwodez vnder
745: Of hore okez ful hoge a hundreth togeder;
746: Þe hasel and þe haȝþorne were harled al samen,
747: With roȝe raged mosse rayled aywhere,
748: With mony bryddez vnblyþe vpon bare twyges,
749: Þat pitosly þer piped for pyne of þe colde.
750: Þe gome vpon Gryngolet glydez hem vnder,
751: Þurȝ mony misy and myre, mon al hym one,
752: Carande for his costes, lest he ne keuer schulde
753: To se þe seruyse of þat syre, þat on þat self nyȝt
754: Of a burde watz borne oure baret to quelle;
755: And þerfore sykyng he sayde, 'I beseche þe, lorde,
756: And Mary, þat is myldest moder so dere,
757: Of sum herber þer heȝly I myȝt here masse,
758: Ande þy matynez to-morne, mekely I ask,
759: And þerto prestly I pray my pater and aue
763: He sayned hym in syþes sere,
765: NADE he sayned hymself, segge, bot þrye,
766: Er he watz war in þe wod of a won in a mote,
767: Abof a launde, on a lawe, loken vnder boȝez
768: Of mony borelych bole aboute bi þe diches:
769: A castel þe comlokest þat euer knyȝt aȝte,
770: Pyched on a prayere, a park al aboute,
771: With a pyked palays pyned ful þik,
772: Þat vmbeteȝe mony tre mo þen two myle.
773: Þat holde on þat on syde þe haþel auysed,
774: As hit schemered and schon þurȝ þe schyre okez;
775: Þenne hatz he hendly of his helme, and heȝly he þonkez
776: Jesus and sayn Gilyan, þat gentyle ar boþe,
777: Þat cortaysly had hym kydde, and his cry herkened.
778: 'Now bone hostel,' coþe þe burne, 'I beseche yow ȝette!'
779: Þenne gerdez he to Gryngolet with þe gilt helez,
780: And he ful chauncely hatz chosen to þe chef gate,
781: Þat broȝt bremly þe burne to þe bryge ende
787: Þe burne bode on blonk, þat on bonk houed
788: Of þe depe double dich þat drof to þe place;
789: Þe walle wod in þe water wonderly depe,
790: Ande eft a ful huge heȝt hit haled vpon lofte
791: Of harde hewen ston vp to þe tablez,
792: Enbaned vnder þe abataylment in þe best lawe;
793: And syþen garytez ful gaye gered bitwene,
794: Wyth mony luflych loupe þat louked ful clene:
795: A better barbican þat burne blusched vpon neuer.
796: And innermore he behelde þat halle ful hyȝe,
797: Towres telded bytwene, trochet ful þik,
798: Fayre fylyolez þat fyȝed, and ferlyly long,
800: Chalkwhyt chymnees þer ches he innoȝe
801: Vpon bastel rouez, þat blenked ful quyte;
802: So mony pynakle payntet watz poudred ayquere,
803: Among þe castel carnelez clambred so þik,
804: Þat pared out of papure purely hit semed.
805: Þe fre freke on þe fole hit fayr innoghe þoȝt,
806: If he myȝt keuer to com þe cloyster wythinne,
807: To herber in þat hostel whyl halyday lested,
809: He calde, and sone þer com
811: On þe wal his ernd he nome,
813: 'Gode sir,' quoþ Gawan, 'woldez þou go myn ernde
814: To þe heȝ lorde of þis hous, herber to craue?'
815: 'Ȝe, Peter,' quoþ þe porter, 'and purely I trowee
816: Þat ȝe be, wyȝe, welcum to won quyle yow lykez.'

2326: 'Blynne, burne, of þy bur, bede me no mo!
2327: I haf a stroke in þis sted withoute stryf hent,
2328: And if þow rechez me any mo, I redyly schal quyte,
2329: And ȝelde ȝederly aȝayn--and þerto ȝe tryst--
2331: Bot on stroke here me fallez--
2335: The haþel heldet hym fro, and on his ax rested,
2336: Sette þe schaft vpon schore, and to þe scharp lened,
2337: And loked to þe leude þat on þe launde ȝede,
2338: How þat doȝty, dredles, deruely þer stondez
2339: Armed, ful aȝlez: in hert hit hym lykez.
2340: Þenn he melez muryly wyth a much steuen,
2341: And wyth a rynkande rurde he to þe renk sayde:
2342: 'Bolde burne, on þis bent be not so gryndel.
2343: No mon here vnmanerly þe mysboden habbez,
2344: Ne kyd bot as couenaunde at kyngez kort schaped.
2345: I hyȝt þe a strok and þou hit hatz, halde þe wel payed;
2346: I relece þe of þe remnaunt of ryȝtes alle oþer.
2347: Iif I deliuer had bene, a boffet paraunter
2348: I couþe wroþeloker haf waret, to þe haf wroȝt anger.
2349: Fyrst I mansed þe muryly with a mynt one,
2350: And roue þe wyth no rof-sore, with ryȝt I þe profered
2351: For þe forwarde þat we fest in þe fyrst nyȝt,
2352: And þou trystyly þe trawþe and trwly me haldez,
2353: Al þe gayne þow me gef, as god mon schulde.
2354: Þat oþer munt for þe morne, mon, I þe profered,
2355: Þou kyssedes my clere wyf--þe cossez me raȝtez.
2356: For boþe two here I þe bede bot two bare myntes
2359: Þenne þar mon drede no waþe.
2360: At þe þrid þou fayled þore,
2361: And þerfor þat tappe ta þe.
2362: 'For hit is my wede þat þou werez, þat ilke wouen girdel,
2363: Myn owen wyf hit þe weued, I wot wel for soþe.
2364: Now know I wel þy cosses, and þy costes als,
2365: And þe wowyng of my wyf: I wroȝt hit myseluen.
2366: I sende hir to asay þe, and sothly me þynkkez
2367: On þe fautlest freke þat euer on fote ȝede;
2368: As perle bi þe quite pese is of prys more,
2369: So is Gawayn, in god fayth, bi oþer gay knyȝtez.
2370: Bot here yow lakked a lyttel, sir, and lewté yow wonted;
2371: Bot þat watz for no wylyde werke, ne wowyng nauþer,
2372: Bot for ȝe lufed your lyf; þe lasse I yow blame.'
2373: Þat oþer stif mon in study stod a gret whyle,
2374: So agreued for greme he gryed withinne;
2375: Alle þe blode of his brest blende in his face,
2376: Þat al he schrank for schome þat þe schalk talked.
2377: Þe forme worde vpon folde þat þe freke meled:
2379: In yow is vylany and vyse þat vertue disstryez.'
2380: Þenne he kaȝt to þe knot, and þe kest lawsez,
2381: Brayde broþely þe belt to þe burne seluen:
2382: 'Lo! þer þe falssyng, foule mot hit falle!
2383: For care of þy knokke cowardyse me taȝt
2384: To acorde me with couetyse, my kynde to forsake,
2385: Þat is larges and lewté þat longez to knyȝtez.
2386: Now am I fawty and falce, and ferde haf ben euer
2387: Of trecherye and vntrawþe: boþe bityde sorȝe
2389: I biknowe yow, knyȝt, here stylle,
2392: And efte I schal be ware.'
2393: Thenn loȝe þat oþer leude and luflyly sayde:
2394: 'I halde hit hardily hole, þe harme þat I hade.
2395: Þou art confessed so clene, beknowen of þy mysses,
2396: And hatz þe penaunce apert of þe poynt of myn egge,
2397: I halde þe polysed of þat plyȝt, and pured as clene
2398: As þou hadez neuer forfeted syþen þou watz fyrst borne;
2399: And I gif þe, sir, þe gurdel þat is golde-hemmed,
2400: For hit is grene as my goune. Sir Gawayn, ȝe maye
2401: Þenk vpon þis ilke þrepe, þer þou forth þryngez
2402: Among prynces of prys, and þis a pure token
2403: Of þe chaunce of þe grene chapel at cheualrous knyȝtez.
2404: And ȝe schal in þis Nwe Ȝer aȝayn to my wonez,
2405: And we schyn reuel þe remnaunt of þis ryche fest
2407: Þer laþed hym fast þe lorde
2408: And sayde: 'With my wyf, I wene,
2411: 'Nay, for soþe,' quoþ þe segge, and sesed hys helme,
2412: And hatz hit of hendely, and þe haþel þonkkez,
2413: 'I haf soiorned sadly; sele yow bytyde,
2414: And he ȝelde hit yow ȝare þat ȝarkkez al menskes!
2415: And comaundez me to þat cortays, your comlych fere,
2416: Boþe þat on and þat oþer, myn honoured ladyez,
2417: Þat þus hor knyȝt wyth hor kest han koyntly bigyled.
2418: Bot hit is no ferly þaȝ a fole madde,
2419: And þurȝ wyles of wymmen be wonen to sorȝe,
2420: For so watz Adam in erde with one bygyled,
2421: And Salamon with fele sere, and Samson eftsonez--
2422: Dalyda dalt hym hys wyrde--and Dauyth þerafter
2423: Watz blended with Barsabe, þat much bale þoled.
2424: Now þese were wrathed wyth her wyles, hit were a wynne huge
2425: To luf hom wel, and leue hem not, a leude þat couþe.
2426: For þes wer forne þe freest, þat folȝed alle þe sele
2427: Exellently of alle þyse oþer, vnder heuenryche
2432: Me þink me burde be excused.
2433: 'Bot your gordel', quoþ Gawayn, 'God yow forȝelde!
2434: Þat wyl I welde wyth guod wylle, not for þe wynne golde,
2435: Ne þe saynt, ne þe sylk, ne þe syde pendaundes,
2436: For wele ne for worchyp, ne for þe wlonk werkkez,
2437: Bot in syngne of my surfet I schal se hit ofte,
2438: When I ride in renoun, remorde to myseluen
2439: Þe faut and þe fayntyse of þe flesche crabbed,
2440: How tender hit is to entyse teches of fylþe;
2441: And þus, quen pryde schal me pryk for prowes of armes,
2442: Þe loke to þis luf-lace schal leþe my hert.
2443: Bot on I wolde yow pray, displeses yow neuer:
2444: Syn ȝe be lorde of þe ȝonder londe þer I haf lent inne
2445: Wyth yow wyth worschyp--þe wyȝe hit yow ȝelde
2446: Þat vphaldez þe heuen and on hyȝ sittez--
2447: How norne ȝe yowre ryȝt nome, and þenne no more?'
2448: 'Þat schal I telle þe trwly,' quoþ þat oþer þenne,
2449: 'Bertilak de Hautdesert I hat in þis londe.
2450: Þurȝ myȝt of Morgne la Faye, þat in my hous lenges,
2451: And koyntyse of clergye, bi craftes wel lerned,
2452: Þe maystrés of Merlyn mony hatz taken--
2453: For ho hatz dalt drwry ful dere sumtyme
2454: With þat conable klerk, þat knowes alle your knyȝtez
2459: Þat ho ne con make ful tame--
2460: 'Ho wayned me vpon þis wyse to your wynne halle
2461: For to assay þe surquidré, ȝif hit soth were
2462: Þat rennes of þe grete renoun of þe Rounde Table;
2463: Ho wayned me þis wonder your wyttez to reue,
2464: For to haf greued Gaynour and gart hir to dyȝe
2465: With glopnyng of þat ilke gome þat gostlych speked
2466: With his hede in his honde bifore þe hyȝe table.
2467: Þat is ho þat is at home, þe auncian lady;
2468: Ho is euen þyn aunt, Arþurez half-suster,
2469: Þe duches doȝter of Tyntagelle, þat dere Vter after
2470: Hade Arþur vpon, þat aþel is nowþe.
2471: Þerfore I eþe þe, haþel, to com to þyn aunt,
2472: Make myry in my hous; my meny þe louies,
2473: And I wol þe as wel, wyȝe, bi my faythe,
2474: As any gome vnder God for þy grete trauþe.'
2475: And he nikked hym naye, he nolde bi no wayes.
2476: Þay acolen and kyssen and kennen ayþer oþer
2477: To þe prynce of paradise, and parten ryȝt þere
2480: To þe knygez burȝ buskez bolde,
2481: And þe knyȝt in þe enker-grene
2483: Wylde wayez in þe worlde Wowen now rydez
2484: On Gryngolet, þat þe grace hade geten of his lyue;
2485: Ofte he herbered in house and ofte al þeroute,
2486: And mony aventure in vale, and venquyst ofte,
2487: Þat I ne tyȝt at þis tyme in tale to remene.
2488: Þe hurt watz hole þat he hade hent in his nek,
2489: And þe blykkande belt he bere þeraboute
2490: Abelef as a bauderyk bounden bi his syde,
2491: Loken vnder his lyfte arme, þe lace, with a knot,
2492: In tokenyng he watz tane in tech of a faute.
2493: And þus he commes to þe court, knyȝt al in sounde.
2494: Þer wakned wele in þat wone when wyst þe grete
2495: Þat gode Gawayn watz commen; gayn hit hym þoȝt.
2496: Þe kyng kyssez þe knyȝt, and þe whene alce,
2497: And syþen mony syker knyȝt þat soȝt hym to haylce,
2498: Of his fare þat hym frayned; and ferlyly he telles,
2499: Biknowez alle þe costes of care þat he hade,
2500: Þe chaunce of þe chapel, þe chere of þe knyȝt,
2501: Þe luf of þe ladi, þe lace at þe last.
2502: Þe nirt in þe nek he naked hem schewed
2503: Þat he laȝt for his vnleuté at þe leudes hondes
2505: He tened quen he schulde telle,
2506: He groned for gref and grame;
2507: Þe blod in his face con melle,
2508: When he hit schulde schewe, for schame.
2509: 'Lo! lorde,' quoþ þe leude, and þe lace hondeled,
2510: 'Þis is þe bende of þis blame I bere in my nek,
2511: Þis is þe laþe and þe losse þat I laȝt haue
2512: Of couardise and couetyse þat I haf caȝt þare;
2513: Þis is þe token of vntrawþe þat I am tan inne,
2514: And I mot nedez hit were wyle I may last;
2515: For mon may hyden his harme, bot vnhap ne may hit,
2516: For þer hit onez is tachched twynne wil hit neuer.'
2517: Þe kyng comfortez þe knyȝt, and alle þe court als
2518: Laȝen loude þerat, and luflyly acorden
2519: Þat lordes and ladis þat longed to þe Table,
2520: Vche burne of þe broþerhede, a bauderyk schulde haue,
2521: A bende abelef hym aboute of a bryȝt grene,
2522: And þat, for sake of þat segge, in swete to were.
2523: For þat watz acorded þe renoun of þe Rounde Table,
2524: And he honoured þat hit hade euermore after,
2525: As hit is breued in þe best boke of romaunce.
2526: Þus in Arthurus day þis aunter bitidde,
2527: Þe Brutus bokez þerof beres wyttenesse;
2528: Syphen Brutus, þe bolde burne, boȝed hider fyrst,
2529: After þe segge and þe asaute watz sesed at Troye,
2533: Now þat here þe croun of þorne,
2534: He bryng vus to his blysse! AMEN.
